column2: Ensure that an error message is printed when _speedThreshold is outside the valid range (1–100).
column3: Instantiate SpeedMonitor with _speedThreshold set to 0 or 101.
column4: _speedThreshold value must be in the ramge {1-100}

column2: Confirm that pushMessage is not called when currentSpeed is below _speedThreshold
column3: Set _speedThreshold to a value greater than the currentSpeed returned by BNFSpeedSensor

column2: Verify that a message is sent to pushMessage when currentSpeed exceeds _speedThreshold
column3: Set _speedThreshold to a value lower than currentSpeed
column4: pushMessage is called with a message formatted as: "Current Speed in Miles(converted speed from KMPH to MPH))"

column2: Ensure that an error message is printed when pushMessage returns a status code indicating failure (400+)
column3: Mock pushMessage to return a status code of 401 or above.
column4: Communitcation Error Message "Error In Communication Unable to Contact Server".
